## 판결문 요약

770 F.2d 1447
    Medicare&Medicaid Gu 34,904UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee,v.Roger Wayne LIPKIS, Defendant-Appellant.
    No. 84-5274.
    United States Court of Appeals,Ninth Circuit.
    Argued and Submitted June 7, 1985.Decided Sept. 10, 1985.
    
      Robert A. Pallemon, Asst. U.S. Atty., Los Angeles, Cal., for plaintiff-appellee.
      Stephen Gilbert, Santa Monica, Cal., for defendant-appellant.
      Appeal from the United States District Court for the Central District of California.
      Before WALLACE, TANG, and WIGGINS, Circuit Judges.
      TANG, Circuit Judge.
    
    
      1
      Roger Lipkis appeals his conviction for:  (1) one count of conspiracy to defraud the United States by receiving "kickbacks" for referring Medi-Cal and Medicare business, under 18 U.S.C. Sec. 371;  (2) four counts of receiving "kickbacks," under 42 U.S.C. Sec. 1396b;  (3) five counts of making false statements on Medicare claim forms, under 42 U.S.C. Sec. 1395nn;  and (4) five counts of mail fraud for submitting the claim forms through the mails, under 18 U.S.C. Sec. 1341.  Lipkis raises two issues on appeal:  first, that the government improperly used statements he made under an informal grant of immunity to obtain his indictment and to prosecute him;  and, second, that there was a fatal variance between the false statement charges under 42 U.S.C.
